summary: Email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Jack Scarola regarding a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund. The prosecutor indicates intent to file a motion to quash the subpoena.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Addressed in email regarding a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund; likely an attorney or legal professional involved in the case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Maxwell' in the email; her counsel filed a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

persons.name: Feldman
persons.context: Mentioned in the filename of an attached exhibit; appears to be related to the subpoena motion filed by Maxwell's counsel.

connections.description: Maxwell's counsel filed a motion with an exhibit referencing Feldman, indicating a legal connection related to subpoena efforts.

events.title: Filing of motion to subpoena Epstein Victim Compensation Fund
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel filed a motion seeking to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

events.title: Email correspondence about subpoena motion
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney emails Jack Scarola about Maxwell's motion to subpoena the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund and intent to file a motion to quash.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza New York NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel filed a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.
The prosecution intended to file a motion to quash the subpoena.
The communication is dated November 16, 2021, from an Assistant United States Attorney to Jack Scarola.
Attachments include a motion and exhibit related to the subpoena, with one referencing 'Feldman'.
